Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip, remains of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink and two black-painted decorative motifs.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394843) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394843)
